mainText.attr1: I've tried to include all possible camera modes, each one has its pros and cons.
Cockpit mode: optimized for dogfights and firing fixed primary and secondary weapons.
Chase mode: optimized for dogfights, less precise forward view but increased situational awareness. Good for firing turrets.
Orbit mode: vanity mode - check out your ship. Good for picking up objects such as cargo pods.
Turret mode: control a single turret. Press the turret mode key again to cycle to the next turret. Manual control of a turret can be good at taking out large mines.
Command mode: optimized for capital ships, or ships with turrets. Good for targeting, and has a built in alternate mouse flight mode. Can issue single ship commands.

Classic space sims tended to not include chase camera modes, this was seen mostly in more arcade shooters. Here however you are given as many choices as I could think off. None of the modes are locked out from use - for example you can use command mode in a fighter or cockpit mode in a cruiser - though if a ship doesn't have at least one turret then you can't use turret mode.
Ship weapons vary so the optimal camera mode can vary from ship to ship.
